info.title: OpenStax Event Capture API
info.description:
The Event Capture API for OpenStax.

Requests to this API should include `application/json` in the `Accept` header.

The desired API version is specified in the request URL, e.g. `[domain]/api/v0`. While the API does support a default version, that version will change over time and therefore should not be used in production code!

200.description: Success.  Returns basic event capture metrics.

data.description: The event object.  Will be of a type that lives in a swagger file inside the schemas directory.

client_clock_occurred_at.description: The RFC 3339 section 5.6 date-time when event actually occurred.

client_clock_sent_at.description: The RFC 3339 section 5.6 date-time when event was sent to the server.

session_uuid.description: The UUID of the current session, previously generated by the client and submitted in a "session started" event.

session_order.description: The event's numerical order within this session. E.g. the first event after a session is started should give 0 for this field, the next one should give 1, etc.

source_metadata.description: The ids and versions needed to retrieve the original source that was interacted with

content_id.description: ID of content visible when this event occurred.

context_version.description: Version that impacts the source content, but is not revision of the content itself, such as a versioned api, or content pipeline

content_index.description: Zero based index of this content in its parent list, if any exists.

scope_id.description: ID for the larger scope of this content
